title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, May 19, 1869
summary: In a letter to AMA secretary E. P. Smith, Scott lists the pros and cons associated with continuing future school projects in the Valley community. He asserts that if the AMA were to remain in Staunton, they "might prevent some of these unruly colored people from doing some mischief which they would if left to themselves."
keywords: African Americans, Education, Church/Religious Activity, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
